title: House Set to Vote to Hold Mark Meadows in Criminal Contempt of Congress
sub_head: Former Trump chief of staff has defied subpoena to testify to Jan. 6 panel investigating the Capitol riot
body:
WASHINGTON—The House was preparing to vote on holding former President Donald Trump’s final chief of staff in criminal contempt of Congress, as lawmakers zeroed in on Mark Meadows’s communications related to the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol by Trump supporters.
The Democratic-led House was moving rapidly after the committee established to investigate the Jan. 6 attack had recommended that the House hold Mr. Meadows in contempt for defying a subpoena.
